events.message: The policyholder reported a car accident occurring at an intersection involving another vehicle. No injuries were immediately reported.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under the Auto Accident cluster based on keywords found in the initial report.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the car accident claim and will coordinate further communications.
The policyholder was contacted to confirm receipt of the claim and informed about the next steps in the process.
The insured was asked to submit the police report, photos of vehicle damage, and any witness statements related to the accident.
All requested documents including accident photos and the police report were received from the claimant for review.
Investigation team began assessing the submitted documents and contacted the other party involved for additional verification.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and the damage assessment report was finalized.
A settlement amount was proposed to the claimant to cover vehicle repair costs as per the damage assessment.
The claimant responded expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the support received during the process.
The insurance company formally approved the claim based on investigation results and claimant agreement.
Payment covering approved repair costs was issued to the claimantâ€™s bank account as scheduled.
The claim was officially closed after payment confirmation and final communication with the insured customer.
Complete claim file with investigation reports and correspondence was archived for future reference and audit purposes.
